properties.short description: Grimoald of the Bariots is Imprisoned after the Siege of Bari
properties.description: Once the city of Bari was captured, Roger II sent Grimoald "in chains to Sicily."
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Grimoald, Count of the Bariots
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Imprisonment of Robert, brother to Geoffrey
properties.description: Because he lacked a hostage, Robert was brought back to Sicily "in chains."
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Count Godfrey of Andria is Sent to Sicily in Exile
properties.description: Once Anzi was taken, Roger II captured Godfrey and sent him to live in Sicily in exile.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Godfrey, Count of Andria
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Tancred of Conversano was Captured and Sent to Sicily
properties.description: Tancred was betrayed by and captured near the end of the siege of Montepeloso.  He was imprisoned and sent to Sicily.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Tancred of Conversano
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
